JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Ms J. Tonks , a welfare rights adviser in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s wife died on DATE . On DATE , the applicant made a claim for widows’ benefits . Subsequently the applicant was sent a further application form under the new system in place as from DATE . He duly completed and returned the application form on DATE . Subsequently the applicant was informed that his claim had been disallowed as he was not entitled to the benefits at issue because his wife had died before DATE .
The applicant did not appeal further as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no such social security benefit was payable to widowers under GPE law .
The domestic law relevant to this application is set out in Runkee and White v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
